text.title: Create a Long Term Care Plan
text.head: Create a Long Term Care Plan
text.p: Financial security today and in the future is what most of us aim for . However , no matter how carefully you plan , your finances and quality of life can still crumble if you are unprepared for long-term care . Long-term care planning involves going through a myriad of concerns , but the process becomes more bearable if you know what steps you need to take . With this guide , start planning for long-term care today and involve your family in doing so .
text.head: Steps

list.item:
Know your needs . Nobody can say for sure what your long-term care needs will be , but there are several ways to help you have a forecast .
Look at your present health situation . Do you have a current condition ? Are you in any risk of incurring illness or injury because of your lifestyle or job ? At the same time , look into your family 's health background ? Are you susceptible to certain health conditions that run in your bloodline ? As you think about these factors , you can consult your doctor so that you 'll have a better assessment of your possible long-term care needs in the future .

Explore different care options . Long-term care can come from different sources and can be administered in different settings . Learn what these are , determine what 's available to you , and decide which among the options you prefer most .
In most cases , loved ones and family members become the main providers of care when a long-term care event takes place . Though they usually assume the role of caregivers out of love and concern , you also need to consider how this situation can affect their job , income , relationships and overall quality of life .
Meanwhile , long-term care can also be provided by professionals . Depending on the level of care needed , care services can be administered in the home , assisted living facilities , adult day care centers , or nursing homes .

Learn about the cost of care in your area . As you create a plan , make sure that you 're familiar with how much long-term care costs in the area where you intend to receive care . This will help you gauge how much you need for care-related expenses . The cost of different care services and settings vary from state to state . For instance , the median annual cost of a private room in a nursing home in Florida is $ 96,725 , whereas in South Carolina , the annual average is only at $ 75,008 .

Determine how you 're going to cover care expenses . Care-related expenses can be covered in different ways . You can opt for self-insurance and pay from your own pocket , purchase long-term care insurance or hybrid products like life insurance or annuities with long-term care coverage , or seek assistance from Medicaid . Each payment option has its own sets of pros and cons . You need to carefully examine these alongside your financial situation to know which is most suitable for you . Asking the help of a professional can help you in doing so .

Create the necessary documents . Advance directives such as a health care power of attorney and living will should also be part of your long-term care plan . These documents are essential because they will serve as your mouthpiece should you become unable to decide and speak for yourself .
A health care power of attorney states the name of the person who will be responsible for making health care related decisions for you when you can no longer do so .
Meanwhile , living will is a document that contains your wishes , preferences , and requests when it comes to medical treatment and health care .
